attributes.description: Operating temperature range maintained within cabin to ensure passenger comfort while supplying conditioned air.
attributes.name: temperatureRange

attributes.description: Pressure levels maintained in the air supply ducts to simulate a stable environment and prevent cabin depressurization.
attributes.name: pressureRange

attributes.description: Humidity levels regulated in the circulated air to prevent condensation and maintain air quality.
attributes.name: humidityRange

attributes.description: Airflow capacity through the supply system ensuring efficient ventilation and proper mixing across cabin zones.
attributes.name: airFlowRate

attributes.description: Response time of the control system ensuring corrective actions are taken within safety margins.
attributes.name: responseTime

designScenario.description: The Air Supply System is engineered as a critical component of a passenger airplane's environmental control infrastructure. It is designed to deliver a continuous flow of conditioned air throughout the cabin, ensuring optimum comfort by regulating temperature, pressure, humidity, and air quality. Utilizing advanced aerospace engineering principles, the system integrates with other aircraft subsystems to provide fault tolerance, rapid system response, and modular maintainability through redundant air handling components, smart sensors, and sophisticated control mechanisms.
designScenario.name: Air Supply System

details.description: The system shall precisely regulate airflow between 500 CFM and 2000 CFM to ensure even distribution of conditioned air throughout the cabin.
The system shall maintain the temperature within the range of 18°C to 26°C using real-time temperature sensors and adaptive heating/cooling elements.
Maintain cabin pressure levels between 0.8 atm and 1.2 atm by employing precision sensors and automatic pressure regulation valves.
Control cabin humidity within the range of 30% to 60% using humidifiers and dehumidifiers to prevent condensation and ensure air quality.
The system shall detect and respond to environmental deviations, initiating corrective measures within 5 seconds to ensure passenger comfort and safety.
Safety mechanisms including redundant fans, sensor arrays, and fail-safe control algorithms shall be implemented to guarantee system integrity in the event of component failure.
The system shall include an intuitive user interface with detailed graphical displays and remote monitoring capabilities to aid flight crew in rapid diagnostics and maintenance planning.
All components of the Air Supply System shall support modular upgrades and routine maintenance in accordance with aviation engineering standards to minimize aircraft downtime.

relationships.description: The Control Unit aggregates sensor data from the Sensor Suite to manage and adjust air supply parameters.
The Temperature Control Module is dependent on the Air Handling Unit for effective heat exchange and distribution of conditioned air.
The Pressure Monitoring System interfaces with the Control Unit to trigger corrective actions when pressure deviations occur.
The Humidity Control System is composed of integrated humidifier and dehumidifier units working in unison for optimal moisture control.
The Gas Monitoring System connects to the Control Unit to provide real-time air quality alerts and adjustments in ventilation rates.
The Air Handling Unit distributes conditioned air to both the Temperature Control System and the Humidity Control System for balanced environmental conditioning.
The Air Handling Unit further aggregates air distribution to the Humidity Control System to ensure consistent moisture content in the cabin.

systemComponents.description: Central processing component responsible for integrating sensor data, managing subsystem operations, and issuing control signals to govern air supply parameters.
systemComponents.name: Control Unit

subComponents.description: User interface module providing real-time displays of air supply statistics and system status to flight crew.
subComponents.name: User Interface Module

subComponents.description: Communication interface module enabling remote monitoring and inter-system connectivity.
subComponents.name: Communication Module

systemComponents.description: Responsible for the mechanical movement and conditioning of air throughout the aircraft cabin.
systemComponents.name: Air Handling Unit

subComponents.description: High-capacity fan unit engineered to provide robust and adjustable airflow.
subComponents.name: Air Fan

subComponents.description: Network of ducts designed for efficient distribution of conditioned air to all cabin zones.
subComponents.name: Air Ducts

subComponents.description: Filtration module tasked with removing particulates and contaminants from the circulated air.
subComponents.name: Filter Module

systemComponents.description: Module dedicated to managing thermal conditions through integrated heating elements, cooling compressors, and precise temperature sensing.
systemComponents.name: Temperature Control System

subComponents.description: Heating element designed to raise the temperature of the supplied air as required.
subComponents.name: Heater

subComponents.description: Cooling unit (commonly an air conditioning compressor) employed to reduce air temperature when necessary.
subComponents.name: Cooler

subComponents.description: High accuracy temperature sensor continuously monitoring the temperature of the incoming and distributed air.
subComponents.name: Temperature Sensor

subComponents.description: Control mechanism that dynamically adjusts the heating and cooling operations based on sensor feedback.
subComponents.name: Temperature Controller

systemComponents.description: System module that monitors and regulates cabin pressure to ensure structural integrity and passenger comfort.
systemComponents.name: Pressure Monitoring System

subComponents.description: High precision pressure sensor providing real-time assessments of cabin pressure.
subComponents.name: Pressure Sensor

subComponents.description: Overpressure relief valve that automatically activates to mitigate dangerous pressure levels.
subComponents.name: Overpressure Valve

systemComponents.description: Component responsible for regulating humidity levels using combined humidification and dehumidification processes.
systemComponents.name: Humidity Control System

subComponents.description: Humidifier unit that increases moisture levels in the air when below desired thresholds.
subComponents.name: Humidifier

subComponents.description: Dehumidifier unit tasked with reducing ambient moisture when levels exceed optimal ranges.
subComponents.name: Dehumidifier

subComponents.description: Humidity sensor that continuously monitors the moisture content of the circulated air.
subComponents.name: Humidity Sensor

systemComponents.description: Module dedicated to assessing air quality by monitoring harmful gas concentrations and ensuring safe breathing environments.
systemComponents.name: Gas Monitoring System

subComponents.description: CO2 sensor designed to detect elevated carbon dioxide levels that could indicate ventilation issues.
subComponents.name: CO2 Sensor

subComponents.description: Ozone sensor used for detecting traces of ozone and other potential airborne pollutants.
subComponents.name: Ozone Sensor

systemComponents.description: A comprehensive assembly of sensors strategically distributed throughout the system to monitor environmental parameters in real-time.
systemComponents.name: Sensor Suite

constraintBlocks.expression: AirFlow >= RequiredFlow; Temperature in [MinTemp, MaxTemp]; Pressure in [MinPressure, MaxPressure]; NoiseLevel <= MaxNoise; MaintenanceInterval = RecommendedCycle
constraintBlocks.name: Operational Constraints

requirements.name: Air Flow Requirement
requirements.text: Determine the air flow rate provided by the unit to ensure adequate ventilation across the cabin.

requirements.name: Operating Temperature Range
requirements.text: Specify the optimal operating temperature range for reliable performance under various flight conditions.

requirements.name: Pressure Compatibility Requirement
requirements.text: Define the compatible pressure range to ensure proper integration with the cabin environmental control.

requirements.name: Noise Level Requirement
requirements.text: Specify the noise level produced during operation, which is important for passenger comfort.

requirements.name: Maintenance Cycle Requirement
requirements.text: Indicate the recommended maintenance cycle to ensure long-term reliability and safety.

rag_context: Air Supply System的所有信息和规格说明包括：系统ID为air_handling_unit，系统名称为Air Handling Unit。规格说明包括：1. 确定了空气处理单元提供的空气流量，确保在整个客舱中有足够的通风和混合。2. 指示了可靠性能的最佳操作温度范围，适用于各种飞行条件。3. 定义了系统的兼容压力范围，确保与整体客舱环境控制的正确集成。4. 指定了单位在运行过程中发出的噪音级别，这对乘客舒适度很重要。5. 指示了建议的维护周期，以确保长期可靠性和安全性。
